## PHQ-9 vs MAAS

PHQ-9 vs MAAS: Harnessing AI for Efficient Questionnaire Comparison Comparing psychological questionnaires can help gain significant insights but can also be an exhaustive task. Imagine comparing the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9), a depression-focused tool, with the Maternal Antenatal Attachment Scale (MAAS), centered on maternity. The diversity in their nature poses a challenge. This is where Harmony comes into play, making comparisons like PHQ-9 vs MAAS a simplified undertaking. Harmony's AI-driven approach allows researchers to compare PHQ-9 vs MAAS on an item level. The tool uses natural language processing to analyze each question and provides a percentage match between the items, aiding researchers to draw analytical correlations. Harmony can also handle multi-language questionnaires, making it a universal tool for cross-study data harmonisation. Hence, to conduct cross-study analysis and longitudinal comparisons between psychological tools like PHQ-9 vs MAAS, Harmony proves highly beneficial. By using advanced AI technologies to aid and simplify this comparison process, Harmony allows researchers to expedite their study efficiency and focus on drawing analtyical insights. Now, comparing PHQ-9 and MAAS or any sort of psychological questionnaires doesn't have to be frustrating or time-consuming. With Harmony, psychologists can streamline the harmonisation process and accelerate their research workflow.

## Compare the items in PHQ-9 and MAAS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import PHQ-9 and MAAS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just PHQ-9 into Harmony</a> - compare PHQ-9 with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just MAAS into Harmony</a> - compare MAAS with other instruments
